channel.title: Router issuez
channel.description:
so i got a new router (2wire) and im trying to port-forward my http server. the problem is that once im done with the port-forwarding, i can only access my http server through localhost on my computer and not through my DNS or through my direct ip, while others can
SO IN CONCLUSION: OTHERS CAN ACCESS PORT-FORWARDED HTTP SERVER THROUGH MY IP WHILE I CAN ONLY ACCESS THROUGH FUCKING LOCALHOST
PLEASE HELP
[size=1pt]ps: sensored is a bitch ass corrupt pedophile doc[/size]

item.title: Router issuez
item.dc:creator: @R3volution1 R3volution`
item.description:
@R3volution1 wrote:

Yeah, I tried that approach but instead I just looked up some tutorial on Google and looked at the applications list thing. It worked but I had to edit my no-ip to override the automatic detection feature and had to screw around with the dropdown to the adapter I was using.

Pain in the ass that thing is huh. :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.title: Router issuez
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“R3volution`, post:8, topic:318346”]I got a 2Wire from Bell, sucks ass to be honest. Did you fix your problem?[/quote]no, i ended up editing host files

the only superficial solution ive found to this is to set your router on dmzplus mode, because then, your internal ip address and external ip address are the same

the only downside to this is that it permits incoming traffic from any port

Read full topic

item.description:

there has to be a way to fix this though router settings though
